thread.title: Dustin Martin puts Richmond contract talks on hold | AFL | Sporting News
thread.title_full: Dustin Martin puts Richmond contract talks on hold | AFL | Sporting News

author: Michael Oxford
title: Dustin Martin puts Richmond contract talks on hold | AFL | Sporting News
text:
January 30, 2017 2:57am EST January 30, 2017 2:52am EST Richmond star Dustin Martin has reportedly told the club he wants to put contract talks on hold until the end of the season. Michael Oxford 
Published on Jan. 30, 2017 
Jan. 30, 2017 
Richmond star Dustin Martin has reportedly told the club he wants to put contract talks on hold until the end of the season. 
MORE: AFLPA outlines player pay demands 
Club president Peggy O'Neal said the 25-year-old was likely to remain a Tiger on Saturday, but according to Herald Sun's Jon Ralph, Martin is going to wait for all available evidence before making a decision on his future. Dustin Martin has told Richmond he will put off contract talks until the end of the year. Can change but that's the current status. — Jon Ralph (@RalphyHeraldSun) January 30, 2017 Details on superfooty coming up. Dusty wants to wait until end of the year to get all available evidence — Jon Ralph (@RalphyHeraldSun) January 30, 2017 
Martin enjoyed a career-best season in 2016, finishing third in the Brownlow with 25 votes - 10 behind the eventual winner Patrick Dangerfield. 
St Kilda has been linked with a move for the bullocking midfielder.
